channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: How the US Capitol is divided 5 years after January 6 riots
Why Trump's plan for Venezuela oil wealth is slippery
Was Manohara Odelia Pinot, an Indonesian-American model, forced to marry Malaysian prince?
How Venezuela’s Nicolas Maduro became a follower of Indian godman Sathya Sai Baba
Is Japan’s Mirumi the Labubu of 2026?
A Polymarket trader made over $400,000 after Maduro’s fall: Did they have insider info?
America retreats, China cornered, Russia relieved: How Trump’s Venezuela raid may hand Bharat an opening
item.description: Donald Trump’s Venezuela raid, intended as a show of force, may instead mark a broader American retreat, reshaping China’s constraints, Russia’s calculations, and Bharat’s options

item.title: How Venezuela is a moment of reckoning for Global South
item.description: For Brics nations and the larger Global South, the US attack on Venezuela is a warning of a coming world where sovereignty will be only rhetoric and multipolarity means hierarchy

item.title: How Saudi-UAE fallout in Yemen raises fears of wider regional conflict
item.description: To allow any group to redraw borders through armed force and foreign patronage is to invite catastrophe at a critical connectivity chokepoint

item.title: India’s semiconductor sector at a turning point: From vision to execution
item.description: India’s semiconductor strategy should be applauded not for its ambition alone, but for its evolving realism, a realism that blends policy focus, industrial pragmatism, ecosystem depth, and relentless execution

item.title: How Saudi-UAE rivalry in Yemen could impact already fragile West Asia
item.description: In the context of Yemen, geography is both an asset and a liability, as its strategic location on the Bab el-Mandeb Strait offers control over critical maritime routes but also exposes it to regional conflicts and foreign interventions

item.title: India needs sharp pragmatism in Myanmar as elections set stage for Junta
item.description: After the elections, China will further expand its influence in Myanmar, which could affect India’s influence and regional security as well. India must have all its negotiating levers ready, even if it is through hard power
